solution_line_template: Mr. Grey had a ${initial_house_value} x {profit_percentage} = $<<{initial_house_value}*{profit_percentage}={grey_profit}>>{grey_profit} profit.
So, Mr. Grey sold the house to Mr. Brown for ${initial_house_value} + ${grey_profit} = $<<{initial_house_value}+{grey_profit}={brown_purchase_price}>>{brown_purchase_price}.
Mr. Brown sold the house ${brown_purchase_price} x {loss_percentage} = $<<{brown_purchase_price}*{loss_percentage}={brown_loss}>>{brown_loss} less than its purchased price.
Thus, Mr. Brown sold it for ${brown_purchase_price} - ${brown_loss} = ${brown_selling_price} to his friend.
